content:
Ladies and gentlemen, the response "no kidding, I wonder if there is a huge bail out for that land" is incredibly engaging. Why? Well, it's because it's unexpected. It takes the conversation in a new direction, and it makes us curious about what the speaker means by "bail out." This response is not predictable, and that makes it all the more interesting. 

Furthermore, this response is also humorous. The use of the phrase "no kidding" is a common colloquialism that we use to show we are surprised or impressed by something. It's relatable and helps build a connection with the audience. The addition of the word "huge" before "bail out" adds some exaggeration, which also adds to the humor.

In conclusion, the response "no kidding, I wonder if there is a huge bail out for that land" is engaging because it is unexpected and humorous. It grabs our attention and makes us wonder what the speaker means.

: I'm sorry, but I have to disagree with my opponent's assessment of the response. While it may be unexpected and humorous to some, it lacks substance and relevance to the conversation at hand. The fact that 86% of the land in Nevada is owned by the US government is a serious issue that affects the lives of many people, and the response does not address that in any way.

Furthermore, the use of the phrase "bail out" is confusing and does not make sense in this context. A bail out typically refers to financial support given to a failing company or industry, and it does not make sense to use that term in relation to land ownership by the government. This only adds to the lack of clarity and relevance of the response.

In conclusion, while the response may be unexpected and humorous, it does not add to the conversation and only serves to distract from the important issue at hand.

The affirmative argues that the response "no kidding, I wonder if there is a huge bail out for that land" is engaging because it is unexpected and humorous. On the other hand, the negative argues that the response lacks substance and relevance to the conversation at hand, and the use of the phrase "bail out" is confusing and does not make sense in this context.

In this debate, the negative presents a stronger argument by effectively rebutting the affirmative's argument and pointing out the lack of relevance and clarity in the response. Therefore, the negative wins the debate.

topic_chat_history:
the white house is at 1600 pennsylvania avenue in washington d.c . and has been there since 1800 and i have never been . have you ? 
 i 've never been , though i want to go.the white house seems behind the curve technologically . w. had solar panels put back on the white house . reagan had them taken off . i wonder why clinton did n’t put them back on . floppy disks ? i wonder if they have laser printers yet . or mice . 
 well other countries apparently like it as well as there are copies in france and ireland apparently . 
 i guess we have a historical link with those countries . the president 's guest house is larger than the white house . i ’m surprised trump can stand the situation . he might have to add some stories to the white house . or maybe rent out the guest house . 
 like he needs more money though apparently he does not reach the top 3 in wealth , that would be jfk , washington and jefferson . 
 though not one of the top three richest presidents , maybe trump can be one of the top pop stars ever to hold office . the indonesian president released 3 pop albums while in office . maybe trump can get four albums out . he might need to get re - elected though . 
 i do n't know , i think i would rather have president banana from zimbabwe put out some tunes instead . 
 what nickname has trump earned ? ? until 1805 , the runner - up in a presidential election became vp . i think this system should be reinstated . the entertainment factor would be tremendous for a public starved for diversion . there 's not much getting done in government anyway . seems like a missed opportunity for some laugh 's 
 they may not appear to get anything done but they do own 86 % of the land of nevada , so they obviously did something right , haha .
topic_chat_fact: 86 % of the land in nevada is owned by the us government
topic_chat_response: no kidding , i wonder if there is a huge bail out that land
